{{< entity_summary >}}
The Government of Canada spent an estimated **\$206.7K in 2021-2022** on contracts with MICHELIN.

Across 41 contracts active since the start of the 2017-2018 fiscal year, 2 have at least one amendment (5%). Of contracts with amendments, the average increase in dollar value was -4% and the average number of amendments was 1. Cumulatively these amendments represent an increase of \$-802.6 over the original contract values.

The average contract duration was 0.29 years, and the average contract value (not including contracts under \$10k) was \$130.8K. The longest contract was 2 years. The largest contract by value (including amendments) was \$3.0M.

{{< /entity_summary >}}
